title: Worklog
Worklog Week 3
content: Week 3 Objectives: Learn and deploy Amazon Lightsail Get familiar with the AWS Cloud9 development environment Study and configure EC2 Auto Scaling Learn NoSQL database concepts with Amazon DynamoDB Manage DNS and domains using Amazon Route 53 Practice AWS CLI: create and manage S3, EC2, IAM, VPC, and DynamoDB resources Tasks to be implemented this week: Day Task Start Date End Date Reference Materials 2 Learn Amazon Lightsail, create an instance and deploy a sample application 19/01/2026 19/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lightsail/ https://000004.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 3 Explore AWS Cloud9, create a development environment and connect to EC2 20/01/2026 20/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloud9/ https://000012.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 4 Study EC2 Auto Scaling, Launch Templates and Auto Scaling Groups 21/01/2026 21/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/ https://000009.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 5 Learn Amazon DynamoDB, table design and basic CRUD operations 22/01/2026 22/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/ https://000006.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 6 Manage domains and DNS records using Amazon Route 53 23/01/2026 23/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/route53/ https://000010.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 7 Practice AWS CLI: create S3 buckets, EC2 instances, IAM users/roles, VPCs and DynamoDB tables 24/01/2026 24/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/ Week 3 Outcomes: Successfully understood and deployed Amazon Lightsail for lightweight and rapid application hosting. Gained hands-on experience using AWS Cloud9 as a cloud-based development environment. Understood the EC2 Auto Scaling mechanism and how to automatically scale resources based on workload. Acquired foundational knowledge of Amazon DynamoDB and NoSQL data modeling concepts. Learned how to manage DNS and domain services with Amazon Route 53, including routing and health checks. Practiced using the AWS CLI to create and manage core AWS services such as S3, EC2, IAM, VPC, and DynamoDB.

title: Worklog Week 2
content: Week 2 Goals: Download and configure AWS CLI (T2) Learn about hosting on S3 (T2) Configure site-to-site VPN (T3) Basic database knowledge with RDS (T4) Monitor the system with CloudWatch (T5) Tasks to be implemented this week: Day Task Start Date Completion Date Source of materials 2 Install and configure AWS CLI, familiarize yourself with basic commands 12/01/2026 12/01/2026 https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/ https://000011.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 3 Learn and practice hosting static websites on Amazon S3 13/01/2026 13/01/2026 https://000057.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 4 Studying the architecture and configuration process of Site-to-Site VPN on AWS 14/01/2026 14/01/2026 https://000003.awsstudygroup.com/vi/5-vpnsitetosite/ 5 Understanding the basics of Amazon RDS and database engines 15/01/2026 15/01/2026 https://000005.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ 6 Monitoring resources and systems with Amazon CloudWatch 16/01/2026 16/01/2026 https://000008.awsstudygroup.com/vi/ Week 2 Results: Successfully installed and configured AWS CLI, understanding how to use profiles, regions, and basic commands to manage AWS resources. Understood the process of deploying a static website on Amazon S3, including bucket configuration, access permissions, and static website hosting. Understand the Site-to-Site VPN architecture, its key components, and the connection flow between on-premises systems and AWS. Have a foundational understanding of Amazon RDS, be able to differentiate between database types, and understand basic database management. Be familiar with Amazon CloudWatch, knowing how to monitor metrics, view logs, and set up alerts for AWS resources.

title: Worklog Week 1
content:
Week 1 Goals: Connect and get acquainted with members of the First Cloud AI Journey.
Understand basic AWS services.
Tasks to be implemented this week: Day Task Start Date Completion Date Resources 2 - Kick-off at the company - Gain a better understanding of company culture, effective work and learning methods - Understand company rules during the work process - Form a team 05/01/2026 05/01/2026 3 - Learn about AWS services + EC2 + S3 + Networking + Database 06/01/2026 06/01/2026 https://cloudjourney.awsstudygroup.com/
https://www.udemy.com/course/vo-long-ve-amazon-web-services/ 4 - Practice drawing diagrams on draw.io following the video tutorial 07/01/2026 07/01/2026 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8isyDe-GwY 5 - Meeting: Understand the strengths and weaknesses of each member, agree on a working method during the learning and project work at AWS 08/01/2026 08/01/2026 6 - AWS Workshop: Creating a personal blog website 09/01/2026 09/01/2026 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8isyDe-GwY 7 - Deploy AWS Workshop website to GitHub January 10, 2026 January 10, 2026 Week 1 Achievements: Completed kick-off at the company, understanding: Work culture Learning process and teamwork Regulations to be followed during the AWS internship Formed a working group, assigned initial roles and agreed on methods for communication and progress reporting. Gain a general understanding of AWS core services, including: EC2: the concept of virtual servers and basic usage S3: object storage and common applications Networking: fundamental knowledge of networking in AWS Practice drawing system architectures on draw.io, understanding how to represent: AWS components Data flow in the system Basic architecture of a cloud application Successfully deploy the workshop website to GitHub, becoming familiar with: Source code management process Publish the website using GitHub Pages Begin to form a teamworkflow, preparing for more complex labs and projects in the following weeks.
